bibl.title: In Re: Ex Parte - Donald Kerracher - Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In Re. Ex Parte: Donald MC Kerracher, Petitioner. No. 1328

We, M.W. Andrews and Mary Mo Kerracher, jointly and sever- ally acknowledge ourselves indebted to the United States of America, in the sum of fifteen hundred, ($1500.00), dollars, lawful money of the United States of America to the levied on our, and each of our goods, , lands and tenants, upon this condition:

Whereas, Charles B. Hopkins, United States Marshall for Western District of Washington and United States of America, respond- ents in the above entitled matter, by their Attorney, Jesse A. Frye, United States Attorney for Western Distrcit of Washington, feeling and deeming themselves aggrevied, by the Order and judgement or discharge made xxx entered and filed in the above entitled proceedings, on the 20th day of September, 1905, of the above petitioner, nad have appealed from said Order and Judgement of discharge, to United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit,

Now, if the said Donald Mc Kerracher shall appear and surrender himself in the Circuit Court of United States for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, on and after filing in the said Circuit Court of the mande of said Circuit Court of Appeals, and from time to time thereafter as he may be required to answer further proceedings and abide by and perform a judgement or order,

which may be had or entered therein in this case and shall abide by and perform a judgement or order, which may not be rendered in the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, and not depart from said Circuit Court, without leave thereof, then this obligation shall be void, otherwise to remain in full force and virtue.
Witness our hands and seals this 21st day of September, A.D. 1905.
Taken and approved this 21st day of September, A.D. 1905, before me.
